title: How Many Calories Are in Water?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in the water—spoiler: zero! Get full nutrition details, equivalents, and tweaks for flavored variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Water?
assumptions: Plain, still water at room temperature; standard glass serving (250 ml).
disclaimer: Plain water has no calories or nutrients; values remain zero regardless of temperature or source. Flavors or additives change this.

quick_answer.text: A 250 ml glass of plain water contains 0 calories.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels, showing zero across all fields for plain water.

tweaks.label: Add slice of lemon (juice from 1/8 lemon)
Infuse with cucumber and mint (negligible calories)

faqs.q: How many calories in the water per glass?
faqs.a: Zero calories in a standard 250 ml glass of plain water.
Plain sparkling water has 0 calories, just like still water.
Plain water provides hydration but no calories, carbs, protein, or fat.
Natural mineral water has 0 calories; trace minerals don't add energy.

faqs.q: How does temperature affect calories in water?
faqs.a: Temperature doesn't change the calorie content—still 0 kcal hot or cold.
